alert.note: Alert for Door (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 11:19AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT FOR DOOR COUNTY... At 1112 AM CDT, reports from automated weather stations indicated that up to around 4 inches of rain had fallen in portions of southern Door County around the Sturgeon Bay area. This was resulting in minor flooding. The heaviest and most persistent rains have now shifted south and east of the Sturgeon Bay area. Up to another inch or so of rain is possible south of Sturgeon Bay, with lighter amounts to the north. This will result in a continuation of minor flooding across southern Door County. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sturgeon Bay, Whitefish Bay, Brussels, Forestville, Clay Banks, Valmy, Rosiere, Shoemaker Point, Carlsville and Namur.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring.
